comments.body: You could also add another test which checks that `docker_config` with `state == absent` is idempotent.
@felixfontein Sorry, but I don't get this one. I'm not sure under what circumstance could `state == absent` be non-idempotent.

It could be that it always returns `changed == True`, for example because deleting doesn't actually work (so it tries to do it both times and fails silently), or because it doesn't detect that it is deleted (and reports that it deleted it another time). Simply trying to delete again and see that the second `state == absent` operation has no change should prevent this.
